intro: Vellereophyton vellereum, commonly known as the velvetleaf, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves that are covered in a fine, velvety texture. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are typically clustered in dense inflorescences. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in disturbed habitats such as roadsides and clearings. Vellereophyton vellereum is an important species in ecological studies due to its role in supporting local insect populations.
